page.title: 01BUILTH WELLS,POWYS. 1985
page.content: Builth Wells,a small market town in Mid-Wales situated on the banks of the River Wye,has a population of approximately 1600. Every Monday,Builth becomes a bustling little town,thronged with farmers because there is usually a cattle or sheep market at Smithfield. Builth has an Arts Centre at Wyeside which incorporates a theatre,cinema, exhibition gallery,workshops and restaurant. In July of every year, the Royal Welsh Show is staged on a permanent site 1 mile outside the town at Llanelwedd. The parish church of St.Mary's was rebuilt in 1875,the original Norman tower being incorporated in the new structure.There are a number of chapels, the most attractive being Alpha,which was built in 1904. {CONT.
